alert.note: Alert for Marion (Mississippi) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 23 at 1:35PM CDT until April 25 at 7:00AM CDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Mississippi... Pearl River Near Columbia affecting Marion County. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL MONDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Pearl River Near Columbia. * WHEN...Until Monday morning. * IMPACTS...At 17.0 feet, Low areas near the river begin to flood. Water covers Old Highway 35 on the west side of the river. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1:15 PM CDT Saturday the stage was 17.1 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage early tomorrow afternoon and continue falling to 15.1 feet Thursday morning. - Flood stage is 17.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Fld Observed Forecasts (1 pm CDT) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Sun Mon Tue Pearl River Columbia 17.0 17.1 Sat 1 pm CDT 17.0 16.7 16.4 &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Forecast includes rainfall on the ground and 24 hours of additional rainfall. Additional information is available at www.water.weather.gov/ahps2/index.php?wfo=JAN The next statement will be issued late tonight at 145 AM CDT.
